P103189.project_name: Africa Stockpiles Programme - Project 1 (Mali, Morocco and Tanzania)

keywords.cdata: Action Plan, audits, Bank policies, bid, Borrower, capacity building, civil society, cleanup, decontamination, Disbursement, Environmental, Environmental Assessment, environmental impacts, Environmental Management, equipment, Financing Plan, Forestry, GLOBAL ENVIRONMENT, Global Environment Facility, Government Organizations, Habitats, Implementing Agency, Indigenous Peoples, inventory, IP, Natural Resources, Natural Resources Management, Pesticide, pesticides, Pollution, Pollution Control, procurement, regulatory framework, Resettlement, result, Safety, sites, stocks, Sustainable Development, TRUST FUND, withdrawal

project_abstract.cdata: The development objectives of the Africa First Stockpiles Program Project for Mali are to (a) eliminating inventoried publicly held obsolete pesticide stocks and associated waste and preparing measures for the future decontamination of soils in priority sites; and (b) implementing measures to reduce and prevent future risks related to pesticides and waste. The Closing Date for Mali Global Environment Facility (GEF) grant, which is part of the second phase of a regional project, will be extended from June 30, 2012 until December 31, 2012. This will be the third and last extension of the project for a cumulative total of 28 months. Delays occurred during the first extension of 22 months mainly because: (i) an abbreviated resettlement action plan was required and its preparation took time and delayed the disposal activities of obsolete pesticides; and (ii) the procurement of a disposal company for the cleanup of obsolete pesticides took longer than expected including the finalization of the bid evaluation report, as well as the approval and signing of the contract which had to be done at the minister level given the size of the contract. Then, the project was interrupted following the military coup of March 22, 2012 and the suspension of operations in accordance with which is still in effect. As a result, no withdrawal application has been processed since March 22, 2012 and project implementation has been interrupted, until further notice. The extension of closing date is necessary to allow time for the possible resumption of operations depending on the conclusions and recommendations of the Operational Procedures (OP) 7.30 assessment mission scheduled in June 2012, and the finalization of all planned priority project activities interrupted in March 2012.

P103189.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectAbstract>En raison de la pollution et pour prévenir une plus grande contamination du sol dans le cadre de la protection des plantes à Molodo, les objectifs spécifiques du Projet d’appui au premier programme d’élimination des stocks africains de pesticides périmés au Mali sont de : fournir des données sur le site (emplacement, routes d’accès, environnement immédiat, adresses et coordonnées des personnes et services responsables de la gestion du site, dépôts de sécurité, etc.) ; identifier les dangers et risques liés aux opérations de Molodo sur la santé et l’environnement ; identifier les tâches à accomplir par remblayage et adopter les mesures d’atténuation des risques appropriées ; fournir un plan pour le suivi des travaux et la gestion du personnel impliqué ainsi qu’un plan d’informations et de communications (sur le chantier et avec d’autres parties). Les impacts négatifs du projet découlent des risques de blessure ou de l’empoisonnement des travailleurs du chantier, ou encore du chargement des pesticides sur un avion et du nettoyage des réservoirs de vaporisation. La fourniture d’une formation appropriée avant le début des opérations, une bonne planification des opérations, le port d’équipements protecteurs et des vérifications journalières des opérations sont autant de mesures dont la mise en œuvre garantira la sécurité des travailleurs et préviendra les cas d’empoisonnement.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
